name.title: Bundle name
name.description: The name of the resulting bundle (with .js extension)

items.title: Source path
items.description: A glob pattern (or array of glob patterns) defining the resources to include in the bundle

source.title: Source paths
source.description: A collection of glob patterns to include in the bundle

items.title: Source path
items.description: A glob pattern (or array of glob patterns) defining the resources to prepend in your bundle

prepend.title: Files to prepend
prepend.description: A set of files to prepend to the bundle

oneOf.title: Bundle Dependency
oneOf.description: If the main field of the library's package.json points to the single file that you need to bundle, then you can opt for a simplified configuration by just adding the package name to your dependencies directly

path.title: Relative path to the dependency
path.description: This is a path to the single module file itself. This path is relative to your application's src folder. Also, you should not include the file extension. .js will be appended automatically

main.title: Main entry point
main.description: This is the main module (entry point) of the package, relative to the path. You should not include the file extension. .js will be appended automatically. Specify false if no main entry point is available for your dependency

env.title: Environment conditional bundling
env.description: This can be used on any dependency in the bundle to indicate what environment builds the dependency should be included in. By default, dependencies are included in all builds.

resources.title: Additional library resources
resources.description: Provide a list of additional files to be included with the bundle

export.title: Global export
export.description: This is the name of the global variable that should be used as the exported value of the module

deps.title: Legacy library dependencies
deps.description: This is an array of dependencies which must be loaded and available before the legacy library can be evaluated

dependencies.title: Bundle dependencies
dependencies.description:
A set of dependencies to be included in your bundle
 Get more info at http://aurelia.io/hub.html#/doc/article/aurelia/framework/latest/the-aurelia-cli/10

bundles.title: Application bundles
bundles.description: Define bundles created during the build

copyFiles.title: Copy files
copyFiles.description: A dictionary (file:destination) specifying files to copy after build

loader.title: Loader configuration
loader.description: Configuring the loader (e.g RequireJS) for the CLI

configTarget.title: Configuration target
configTarget.description: The target bundle where additional loader configs will be appended to the bottom of the file

includeBundleMetadataInConfig.title: includeBundleMetadataInConfig
includeBundleMetadataInConfig.description: Whether to include a "bundles" property in the loader configuration. http://requirejs.org/docs/api.html#config-bundles

extensions.title: Plugin extensions
extensions.description: Extensions to be processed by the plugin

stub.title: Stub
stub.description: If set to true the plugin won't be included in the bundle, resulting in a smaller bundle size. But you can't use the plugin at runtime for files that aren't in the bundle.

plugins.title: Loader plugins
plugins.description: Configure additional loader plugins (e.g. text-plugin, json-plugin ...)

type.title: Loader type
type.description: The type of the loader to use

config.title: Loader configs
config.description: Additional configuration specifically for the selected loader type

rev.title: Build revisions
rev.description: To create builds with revision numbers, you must set rev to true. This will cause a unique revision number to be added to the bundled files

options.title: Build options
options.description: Setup minification, sourcemaps and revision support

baseDir.title: BaseDir
baseDir.description: The baseDir for serving the build target

displayName.title: Displayname
displayName.description: The name to display for the target application

id.title: Target id
id.description: The id for the target application

index.title: App start file
index.description: The default start file for the application

output.title: Output folder
output.description: The folder where the built application will be copied to

displayName.title: Display name
displayName.description: The name to display for the selected css processor

fileExtension.title: File extension
fileExtension.description: The file extension to use for the preprocessor

id.title: CSS preprocessor id
id.description: The id of the selected css preprocssor

source.title: CSS preprocessor sources
source.description: A glob pattern (or array of glob patterns) pointing to the sources to be targeted by the css preprocessor

editor.title: Editor
editor.description: The used editor along preconfigured defaults

displayName.title: Displayname
displayName.description: The name to display of the markup processor

fileExtension.title: Markup file extensions
fileExtension.description: The file extensions to target by the markup processor

id.title: Markup processor id
id.description: The id of the markup processor

source.title: Markup source
source.description: A glob pattern (or array of glob patterns) to the markup sources. In case of Webpack this can be an empty string.

paths.title: Path mappings
paths.description: Path mappings (key/value) for the loader. These will be included into the loader configuration (RequireJS/SystemJS).

baseDir.title: BaseDir
baseDir.description: Browsersync (au run) will serve from this directory

displayName.title: Display name
displayName.description: The name of the platform specific build

id.title: Platform id
id.description: The id of the platform specific build

index.title: Index file (index.html)
index.description: Path relative from project root to the index.html file. CLI updates script tags in this file on build

output.title: Output
output.description: A folder relative from project root where the bundles will be created

hmr.title: (ONLY WP) Hot Module Reloading
hmr.description: ONLY FOR WEBPACK. Define whether hot module reloading should be used with the dev server

port.title: (ONLY WP) Dev Server Port
port.description: ONLY FOR WEBPACK. Define the default port to be used for the dev server

open.title: (ONLY WP) Auto open default browser
open.description: ONLY FOR WEBPACK. Should the default browser be opened automatically

displayName.title: Test framework name
displayName.description: The name to display for the used test framework

id.title: Test framework id
id.description: The id of the used test framework

displayName.title: Displayname
displayName.description: The name to display for the selected transpiler

fileExtension.title: File extension
fileExtension.description: File extensions to be processed by the transpiler

source.title: Transpiler sources
source.description: A glob pattern (or array of glob patterns) for the sources processed by the transpiler. In case of Webpack this can be an empty string

options.title: Transpiler options
options.description: Addtional options to pass to the transpiler

transpiler.title: Transpiler
transpiler.description: The transpiler chosen for the app

displayName.title: Display name
displayName.description: The name of the configured testrunner

id.title: Testrunner Id
id.description: The id of the configured testrunner

source.title: Test source files
source.description: Pointing to the spec files of your application. Can be empty for Webpack

unitTestRunner.title: Test runner
unitTestRunner.description: The testrunner used for your application. In case of Webpack this should be an array of testrunner configurations
